intro: Swammerdamia antennaria, commonly known as the slender antler plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster that resembles an antler, giving it its common name. Swammerdamia antennaria is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
